intro: Rumex javalambrensis, commonly known as the Javalambrense sorrel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Polygonaceae family, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats and sorrels. The plant features alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a distinctive reddish hue on the underside. It produces small, greenish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typically blooming in the spring. Rumex javalambrensis is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories.
